alert.note: Alert for Cottle; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 7:10PM CDT until May 04 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KING AND SOUTHEASTERN COTTLE COUNTIES... At 710 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 11 miles east of Chalk, or 19 miles southeast of Paducah, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern King and southeastern Cottle Counties. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
